name: places/ChIJrW4JIp1ZwokRCe0L95wnvvA
formattedAddress: Moynihan Train Hall, 421 8th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
adrFormatAddress: Moynihan Train Hall, 421 8th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA

originalText.text:
I’m currently sitting in seat 10A of this Amtrak train that is about to depart to Philadelphia, eating this delectable croissant from Vesuvio as messy as a bulldog eating a bowl of chili in hopes that no one will sit next to me.

I was initially not going to eat after work, as I’m trying to be rockstar skinny, but Vesuvio was so chic and inviting in the middle of Moynihan train station that I couldn’t help but cop a coffee and a croissant.

After ringing up $5 for a butter croissant I felt I had been stabbed in the back, but eating this right now, I can assure you, it was worth it. Not too buttery and had great structure. No one has sat next to me yet either….

The to-go coffee cup was inspiringly beautiful. I know I probably sound like I’m being fake deep with that, but these small details make a huge difference. Coffee tastes fantastic too…….I will likely regret a cup of coffee this late, but my adrenal glands have been put through the absolute ringer these past few months, so I think I’ll be ight. It’s in gods hands. The big fella got me!

IG @jnov_
Tiktok @jnov__

originalText.text: Good coffee serving la colombe coffee and pretty store front but some of the pastries looked pretty sad.

text.text: Good coffee serving la colombe coffee and pretty store front but some of the pastries looked pretty sad.

originalText.text: Stopped there at around 6:30AM before catching my train. I'm so glad I walked right past the Starbucks and straight to Vesuvio. The quiche was SO flavorful and carefully packaged so I could eat it on the Amtrak. I also got a pistachio cruffin because why not?! I'm surprised I didn't make moaning sounds on the train. To die for! I'm especially grateful that there was a truly delicious food option available so early in the morning and at such a convenient location. This was the opposite of sad train station food. They also have the GOOD oatmilk (barista blend!) for coffee. This is my new go-to at Penn Station!

originalText.text:
Nasty pastry case, Flies are part of the pastry experience here… flies were standing on all the pastries. When I asked about it the staff barely bat an eye. They found it funny actually. Strange indifferent reaction from them. Seems very normal to this place to have flies on the pastries. There have been flies every time that I’ve stopped by here in recent times.

I use to really enjoy the bombolinis until I realized there’s flies in the case. Guess I won’t be going anymore.

originalText.text: This place is fantastic. Great coffee and amazing pastries. I don't know why people bother with Starbucks when this place is in the train station!
